result.execSummary:
The defendant Coltyn Ray Safford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Coltyn Ray Safford is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Coltyn Ray Safford was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court
St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 1.
Probation may be transferred to Texas.
Court notes 3 days credit if revoked.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: -Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Coltyn Ray Safford

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Edward Minser, DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros, DF: Coltyn Ray Safford appeared.  Court called.  There is an agreement.  DE files a plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  State files an amended Information.  Ct. 2 is amended to 961.41(1m)(b).  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE guilty of Ct 2. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 2 in 16CF32
- S/W 15 months probation with conditions
- 3 days credit if revoked
- Probation can be transferred to Texas
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid through probation
- DE is eligible to apply for expungement under 973.015 if he successfully completes probation
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 21, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and probable cause the DE committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.
